description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about:
This section asks for information about:
This section asks for information about the main concern for your business.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:

list: skills in high demand and support or training in skills

contents.description: The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s trading status?

description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

in: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

question.title: How did your business's exporting in June 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did your business's cost of exporting in June 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did the time spent on exporting in June 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
Did your business experience an increase in any of the following exporting challenges in June 2023, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced an increase in additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules of origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges
options.value: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges

question.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

question.title: Does your business currently use rules of origin to access lower or zero tariffs on exports?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'rules of origin'

contents.description: This is the criteria used to determine where a product was made. They exist in all Free Trade Agreements to ensure only goods made in countries that are part of the agreement can benefit from lower tariffs.
View further information about rules of origin on the gov.uk website (this link opens in a new tab)

options.label: Yes, to both EU and non-EU countries
options.value: Yes, to both EU and non-EU countries

question.title: How has using rules of origin when exporting to the EU changed the amount of administration for your business?

contents.description: This is referring to gathering the information and completing the paperwork to prove goods comply with rules of origin.

blocks.page_title: Effect of rules of origin on administration

question.title: Why does your business not currently use rules of origin to access lower or zero tariffs?

options.label: Administrative costs of rules of origin outweigh the potential tariff saving
options.value: Administrative costs of rules of origin outweigh the potential tariff saving

options.label: Exports do not meet rules of origin requirements
options.value: Exports do not meet rules of origin requirements

options.label: Lack of understanding, staffing or expertise to use rules of origin
options.value: Lack of understanding, staffing or expertise to use rules of origin

options.label: The business has attempted to use rules of origin but has been unsuccessful
options.value: The business has attempted to use rules of origin but has been unsuccessful

options.label: The EU does not charge tariffs on the goods the business exports
options.value: The EU does not charge tariffs on the goods the business exports

blocks.page_title: Reasons for not using rules of origin

question.title: Is your business currently experiencing a shortage of workers?
How has the shortage of workers affected your business?

options.label: Business had to pause trading entirely
options.value: Business had to pause trading entirely

options.label: Had to pause trading of some of the business
options.value: Had to pause trading of some of the business

options.label: Business had to recruit temporary workers
options.value: Business had to recruit temporary workers

question.title: Which of the following agreements, if any, does your business use in contracts of employment for current employees?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'contracts of employment'

contents.description: This refers to a written agreement between an employer and employee.

options.label: Non-compete agreements
options.description: An agreement where a business prohibits employees from joining or starting a competitor business for a period of time after they leave the firm

options.label: Confidentiality agreements
options.description: An agreement in which a business prohibits employees from sharing confidential information about their employer, the work they do or their experiences as an employee with those outside the firm during or after they leave their job

options.label: Non-recruitment of co-worker agreements
options.description: An agreement in which employees at a business are prohibited from recruiting former colleagues after they leave the firm

options.label: Non-solicitation agreements
options.description: An agreement in which employees at a business are prohibited from soliciting former clients after they leave the firm

options.label: No-poaching agreements
options.description: An agreement that prohibits employees from recruiting or approaching employees of another business. For instance, a franchise contract might specify that a franchisee cannot recruit employees of another franchisee

blocks.page_title: Contractual agreements used by the business

question.title: Approximately, what percentage of your business's current employees have these agreements in their contracts of employment?

contents.description: Include:

options.label: More than 75%, but not all employees
options.value: More than 75%, but not all employees

question.title: In the last 12 months, has your business had any job applicants with one of these agreements in their current or most recent roles?

contents.description: Include:

options.label: Yes, and the business hired all the job applicants
options.value: Yes, and the business hired all the job applicants

options.label: Yes, and the business hired some of the job applicants
options.value: Yes, and the business hired some of the job applicants

options.label: Yes, and the business did not hire any of the job applicants
options.value: Yes, and the business did not hire any of the job applicants
